ra.name: RetroArch
ra.special_configuration: Custom textures for the NES and N64 using EmuDeck's pre-created folder: Emulation/hdpacks
ra.systems: Retro Game Systems, including but not limited to, Nintendo 64, Saturn and Dreamcast

cemu.name: Cemu
cemu.description: Cemu is a Nintendo Wii U emulator, developed by Exzap and Petergov. That's right, you can emulate Breath of the Wild on the Steam Deck with Cemu.
cemu.special_configuration: BIOS: No additional BIOS are required, keys are required for encrypted ROMs. Hotkeys: EmuDeck's Steam Input profile is required for hotkeys. Place your Wii U ROMs here: Emulation/roms/wiiu/roms. To use Gyro, install SteamDeckGyro from the Tools & Stuff page.

dolphin.name: Dolphin
dolphin.description: Dolphin is a Nintendo Gamecube and Wii emulator, developed by the Dolphin Emulator Project. Re-live your Wii Sports days on the go with this emulator.
dolphin.special_configuration: BIOS: No additional BIOS are required. To improve performance, install Power Tools from the Tools & Stuff page. To use Gyro, install SteamDeckGyro from the Tools & Stuff page.

primehacks.name: Primehack
primehacks.description: Primehack is a fork of Dolphin, intended to modernize the Metroid Prime trilogy, developed by shiiion. Modern FPS controls for the Metroid Prime Trilogy? You got it.
primehacks.special_configuration: BIOS: No additional BIOS are required. Only Metroid Prime Trilogy (Wii) is configured at this time.

ppsspp.name: PPSSPP
ppsspp.description: PPSSPP is a Sony PSP emulator, originally developed by Henrik Rydgård. Portable games on the go, again.
ppsspp.special_configuration: BIOS: No additional BIOS are required. Hotkeys: EmuDeck's Steam Input profile is required for hotkeys.

duckstation.name: DuckStation
duckstation.special_configuration: BIOS: BIOS are required, ROMs do need region specific BIOS. EmuDeck's Steam Input profile is required for hotkeys.

melonds.name: melonDS
melonds.description: melonDS is a Nintendo DS Emulator
melonds.special_configuration: BIOS: BIOS bios files are optional.

citra.name: Citra
citra.description: Citra is a Nintendo 3DS emulator, developed by the Citra team. Unfortunately, the Steam Deck does not come with a 3D slider.
citra.special_configuration: BIOS: No additional BIOS are required, keys are required for encrypted ROMs. Hotkeys: EmuDeck's Steam Input profile is required for hotkeys. To use Gyro, install SteamDeckGyro from the Tools & Stuff page.

pcsx2.name: PCSX2QT
pcsx2.description: PCSX2 is a Sony Playstation 2 emulator, developed by the PCSX2 team. JRPGs galore.
pcsx2.special_configuration: BIOS: BIOS are required, ROMs do not need region specific BIOS.

rpcs3.name: RPCS3
rpcs3.description: RPCS3 is a Sony PlayStation 3 emulator, originally developed by DH, Hykem, and AlexAltea. That's right, the Steam Deck can emulate PS3 too.
rpcs3.special_configuration: Firmware: Install firmware through the RPCS3 UI. Follow RPSC3's Quickstart Guide: here. You will need to tweak settings for most games. Check RPCS3's Wiki for specific setting recommendations.

yuzu.name: Yuzu
yuzu.special_configuration: Firmware: Place keys and firmware place in: Emulation/bios/yuzu. To use Gyro, install SteamDeckGyro from the from the Tools & Stuff page.

ryujinx.name: Ryujinx
ryujinx.description: Ryujinx is a Nintendo Switch emulator, originally developed by gdkchan. Ryujinx can promise excellent accuracy for your favorite Nintendo Switch games.
ryujinx.special_configuration: Firmware: Install firmware through the Ryujinx UI. Place keys in: Emulation/bios/ryujinx/keys. To use Gyro, install SteamDeckGyro from the Tools & Stuff page.

xemu.name: Xemu
xemu.description: Xemu is a Microsoft Xbox emulator, originally developed by Matt Borgerson. Master Chief: I think we're just getting started.
xemu.special_configuration: BIOS: BIOS are required: mcpx_1.0.bin and modified retail BIOS, Complex_4627v1.03.bin.

rmg.name: Rosalies Mupen Gui
rmg.description: Rosalies Mupen Gui is a fork of Mupen64Plus-Next with a better gui and is usable outside of RetroArch.
rmg.special_configuration: DD games require a bios file. EmuDeck's Steam Input profile is required for hotkeys.

mame.name: MAME
mame.description: MAME is a Multiple Arcade Machine Emulator, originally developed by Nicola Salmoria. Invite a friend over, and re-live the arcade days over a match of 1943 or Bubble Bobble.
mame.special_configuration:
BIOS: BIOS are required for some MAME ROMs. Ideally use ROMS that are the same version as MAME's version. MAME often releases improved versions of ROMS to improve compatibility. EmuDeck currently supports the current versions:
MAME (Standalone) and MAME (Current), MAME 2010, MAME 2003, as RetroArch Cores.

vita3k.name: Vita3K
vita3k.description: Vita3K is a Sony Playstation Vita emulator, developed by the Vita3K team. No memory card needed.
vita3k.special_configuration: Firmware: Install firmware through the Vita3K UI. Follow Vita3K's instructions in the UI. You will need to tweak settings for most games. Many are still not playable. Check Vita3K's compatibility list here.

scummvm.name: ScummVM
scummvm.description: ScummVM is a program that allows users to play supported adventure games, originally developed by Ludvig Strigeus and Vincent Hamm. Look behind you, a three-headed monkey!
scummvm.special_configuration: BIOS: No additional BIOS are required. Read the wiki, here, for guides on how to configure ScummVM for Steam ROM Manager and EmulationStation-DE.

xenia.name: Xenia
xenia.description: Xenia is a Microsoft Xbox 360 emulator, originally developed by benvanik. Coming soon to a Steam Deck near you.
xenia.special_configuration: BIOS: No additional BIOS are required. Xenia is not currently supported by EmuDeck.

srm.name: Steam Rom Manager
srm.description: Steam Rom Manager is the app we use to add your Roms to your Steam Library.
srm.special_configuration: SRM is a powerfull but complex tool

esde.name: EmulationStation DE
esde.description: EmulationStation Desktop Edition (ES-DE) is a frontend application for browsing and launching games from your multi-platform game collection.
esde.altWarning: This action will replace your installation with ESDE 2.0 Prerelease. To undone this action you'll need to click the ReInstall button
